OSAS-QP-32
Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY Don Severino delas Alas Campus Indang, Cavite
JOB EXPERIENCE PROGRAM (Formerly Work for Tuition Program)
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT
Known by all men by these presents:
This Financial Assistance Agreement made and entered into by and between:
The CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY, a Government educational institution created and existed under Philippine laws, with principal office at its campus situated at the Municipality of Indang, Province of Cavite, duly represented herein by its President, _____________________________, herein after referred to as the UNIVERSITY.
And
________________________________, represented by ____________________________ (Name of student) (Parent/ Guardian) ________ years old, Filipino and residing at ______________________________________ _______________________________________________ herein called the “RECIPIENT”.
WITNESSETH
WHEREAS, the CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY (CvSU), pursuant to its Charter (Republic Act No. 8468), is committed to provide a scholarship program or financial assistance program to assist the poor but deserving students to qualify for admission to the UNIVERSITY.
WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the former Don Severino Agricultural College now CvSU through its Resolution No. 9, s.1990, has devised the “Work for Tuition Program” now named as “Job Experience Program”, herein after referred to as the Program, which is open to any student who meets all the following qualifications:
a) Enrolled in the prescribed regular load for the chosen academic program,
b) Does not have a failing/conditional grade in any academic subjects,
c) Of good moral character,
d) Belongs to a family whose annual gross income does not exceed P137,000.
WHEREAS, the RECIPIENT represents that he/she meets all the above qualifications, has voluntarily applied for acceptance in the course specified herein under the Program, and undertakes to fully perform the obligations pertaining thereto,
V01-2018-05-28

NOW, THEREFORE, for and in consideration of the forgoing, the UNIVERSITY, based on the evaluation conducted by its Office of Student Affairs, hereby admits the RECIPIENT as a participant in its “Job Experience Program”, subject to the following terms and conditions:
1. The RECIPIENT shall pursue a ____-year course leading to the certificate/ degree of ___________________________starting with the _______ Semester of School Year ________________.
2. For ________ Semester, SY _______________, the RECIPIENT undertakes to render not less than ________________________( ) hours of work service to the UNIVERSITY, as evidenced by Daily Time Records to be certified by the Head of the Office or Unit where the work service was rendered and filed with the Office of the Student Affairs;
3. The Nature of the work service includes maintenance and cleanliness of the building and surroundings and other university projects. The schedule during which it shall be rendered, and the Office or Unit to which the RECIPIENT shall be assigned shall be determined by the University’s Office of the Student Affairs;
4. The RECIPIENT agrees that the UNIVERSITY may terminate participation in the program for cause and upon notice, such as deficient scholastic performance, unsatisfactory work service, frequent absences or tardiness, gross discourtesy or disobedience and other similar causes;
5. Upon termination of the participation in the Program, the STUDENT may continue the course only upon payment of the prescribed tuition, registration and other fees.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereby affix their signatures to the provisions this ______ day of ______________, 20___ at Indang, Cavite.
______________________________ ______________________________ Name of University President Name of Parent/Guardian President, CvSU (Signature over printed name)
______________________________ Name of Recipient (Signature over printed name)
Signed in the presence of
______________________________ ______________________________ Name of Dean Name of Head Dean, OSAS Head, Scholarship and Financial Assistance Services
______________________________ Name of Guarantor Guarantor (Signature over printed name)
V01-2018-05-28

ACKNOWLEDGMENT
In the municipality of Indang, Province of Cavite, Philippines, this ____ day of _________________ personally appeared before me ________________________ person who executed the forgoing instrument and who acknowledges before me that the same is their own free and voluntary act and deed.
This instrument of two (2) pages including the page wherein acknowledgment is written and referring to the Contract of Scholarship is signed at the foot of the instrument of the fist page by the interested witness thereto.
WITNESS MY HAND and SEAL OF MY NOTARIAL OFFICE on the date at the place first above written.
DOC. No. ______________________ Page No. ______________________ Book No. ______________________
V01-2018-05-28

20 January 2020
TO: LILIAN O. SIDAMON
FROM NOEL A. : SEDIGO Campus Dean
SUBJECT: DESIGNATION AS HEAD, OFFICE OF THE STUDENT AFFAIRS AND SERVICES (OSAS)
Congratulations! Due to your exceptional job performance, you are hereby re- designated as Head of the Office of the Student Affairs and Services of this campus for 1 st Semester of A.Y. 2020-2021. As such, you are to:
1. Supervise the operation of the following units: a. Scholarship
i. Student Organization ii. Sports and Socio-cultural Affairs b. Student Welfare c. Guidance Counselling d. Student Discipline e. Student Publication f. Student Placement 2. Formulate, recommend and implement guidelines and regulations related to the operations of the various units of the Office of Student Affairs; 3. Ensure the implementation of the policies stipulated in the student handbook; 4. Exercise overall supervision of the student admission ; and 5. Perform other function as maybe assigned by higher authorities.
It is understood that this designation is in addition to your usual duties and does not entail additional compensation except those currently accruing to the position and is subject to such other roles and regulation as may be later prescribed by this office and/or by higher authorities.
Please be guided accordingly,
